summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, informing them of a reproduction of discovery materials due to a Bates stamping error. The materials include Deutsche Bank records related to Jeffrey Epstein and a UBS subpoena return.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case referenced in the letter (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

events.title: Reproduction of Discovery Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office reproduces and sends corrected discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel due to a Bates stamping error.

events.title: UBS Subpoena Return
events.description: A subpoena return from UBS bank is listed among the reproduced discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office corrected a Bates stamping error in discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, re-producing documents with numbers SDNY_GM_02742184 through SDNY_GM_02742302.
The reproduced discovery includes Deutsche Bank materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating financial records are part of the evidence.
The reproduced discovery also includes a UBS Subpoena Return dated December 15, 2020, showing ongoing collection of financial records.
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team at this time included attorneys from three different law firms: Cohen & Gresser LLP, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., and the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.
